segment.source: Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) Technical Reference (Windows 10)
segment.target: Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) Technical Reference (Windows 10)

segment.source: The Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) enables network administrators and other IT professionals to automate and centrally manage the Windows®, Microsoft® Office, and select other Microsoft products volume and retail-activation process.
segment.target: The Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) enables network administrators and other IT professionals to automate and centrally manage the Windows®, Microsoft® Office, and select other Microsoft products volume and retail-activation process.

segment.source: Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) Technical Reference
segment.target: Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) Technical Reference

segment.source: The Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) enables network administrators and other IT professionals to automate and centrally manage the Windows®, Microsoft® Office, and select other Microsoft products volume and retail-activation process.
segment.target: The Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) enables network administrators and other IT professionals to automate and centrally manage the Windows®, Microsoft® Office, and select other Microsoft products volume and retail-activation process.

segment.source: VAMT can manage volume activation using Multiple Activation Keys (MAKs) or the Windows Key Management Service (KMS).
segment.target: VAMT can manage volume activation using Multiple Activation Keys (MAKs) or the Windows Key Management Service (KMS).

segment.source: VAMT is a standard Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in that requires the Microsoft Management Console (MMC) 3.0.
segment.target: VAMT is a standard Microsoft Management Console (MMC) snap-in that requires the Microsoft Management Console (MMC) 3.0.

segment.source: VAMT can be installed on any computer that has one of the following Windows operating systems:
segment.target: VAMT can be installed on any computer that has one of the following Windows operating systems:

segment.source: VAMT is designed to manage volume activation for: Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows 10, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2012 R2, Microsoft Office 2010, and Microsoft Office 2013.
segment.target: VAMT is designed to manage volume activation for: Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1, Windows 10, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2012 R2, Microsoft Office 2010, and Microsoft Office 2013.

segment.source: Computers installed with volume editions of Windows XP or Windows Server 2003 cannot be managed using VAMT.
segment.target: Computers installed with volume editions of Windows XP or Windows Server 2003 cannot be managed using VAMT.

segment.source: However, Office 2010 and Office 2013 products installed on these two operating systems can still be managed.
segment.target: However, Office 2010 and Office 2013 products installed on these two operating systems can still be managed.

segment.source: VAMT is only available in an EN-US (x86) package.
segment.target: VAMT is only available in an EN-US (x86) package.

segment.source: Provides a description of VAMT and common usages.
segment.target: Provides a description of VAMT and common usages.

segment.source: Describes how to install VAMT and use it to configure client computers on your network.
segment.target: Describes how to install VAMT and use it to configure client computers on your network.

segment.source: Describes how to add client computers into VAMT.
segment.target: Describes how to add client computers into VAMT.

segment.source: Describes how to add and remove a product key from VAMT.
segment.target: Describes how to add and remove a product key from VAMT.

segment.source: Describes how to activate a client computer by using a variety of activation methods.
segment.target: Describes how to activate a client computer by using a variety of activation methods.

segment.source: Describes how to save, import, export, and merge a Computer Information List (CILX) file using VAMT.
segment.target: Describes how to save, import, export, and merge a Computer Information List (CILX) file using VAMT.

segment.source: Provides step-by-step instructions for using VAMT in typical environments.
segment.target: Provides step-by-step instructions for using VAMT in typical environments.
